intro: Hieracium subconspersum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. It is often found in temperate regions and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
